Acquisition: Acquisition Process
   
  Acquisition Introduction  
         
 

What is an acquisition program?

The key terms in the definition are directed, funded and need.

The acquisition process begins with a Initial Capabilities Document (ICD). The ICD is the initial identification/description of a certain operational need in broad, time phased, operational goals, describing required capabilities to perform a given mission. It is generated by the user in response to projected mission needs or a war fighting deficiency.

  Multiple concepts and material approaches to optimize the way the DoD provides these capabilities will be examined, including such considerations as affordability, technology maturity and responsiveness.

   
  Additional details on acquisition requirements can be found in the DoDD 5000.01 and DoDI 5000.02.
